Articles.Content: Dito, just waiting for sirkuts pack to get released. you'll find all what you Need there then, i guess.

While taking a stroll in my 8 or 12 legged walkers, the rotatrons bearing the weight of the craft occasionally spontaneously disassemble unanimously. Many of them continue to work, but are off-axis. Is anyone familiar with this problem, or know of any fix? I'm sure its not the weight of the craft, it is very small and I've tested by putting a lot of weight on it without change, and changing the quantity of legs doesn't change anything either.

If you want to experiment with it, the design is very similar to the walker in the "Kerbals at War 2" video, only stripped down to the skeleton.

I'd be interested in seeing some pics.

i'd be interested in seeing some pics.

I can't figure out how to upload pictures. What do I need to do? There doesn't seem to be any instructions on how to do that.
Use tinypic.com

Javascript is disabled. View full album

the last 6 images show how the rotatrons are still connected, but off-axis.

Edited August 10, 2013 by Astronut25
Discovered [imgur] tag

If you want a copy that works on .21 download the file from this thread http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/40559-All-craft-from-my-Constellation-mission-vid and just take the DRobotics(0.20.2) directory to the GameData directory.
take a look here http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/37707-0-21-Magic-Smoke-Industries-Parts-Infernal-Robotics
Parts pack is up, i guess you dont Need DR anymore. Have to give it a try tonight.
Thanks. I searched but failed to find any updates. I must not have searched hard enough.

Thanks. I searched but failed to find any updates. I must not have searched hard enough.

Go to the link viperwolf provided. It's infernal robotics.
When I install this on OSX, all my parts dissapear except for the damned robotics parts, help?
I couldn't seem to get it to work on 0.21... (keeps my inventory from loading) and I really realllllllly want the servos and hinges and such.

Please go to my thread and use this dll. The old Damned Robotic parts won't work unless you modify the CFG files yourself. Alternative is to download the Magic Smoke Industries dll and parts pack. http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/37707-0-21-Magic-Smoke-Industries-Parts-Infernal-Robotics
Oh that's great. Thanks to the messed up part loading of this mod, all the ships in orbit on my save file disappeared.

Hi, I just want to know, is there a way to make the parts sturdier in config files, so they don't bend under pressure as much?

Thanks

Hi, I just want to know, is there a way to make the parts sturdier in config files, so they don't bend under pressure as much?

Thanks

Are you using DR or MSI? If your using DR you will be very happy using MSI instead. More options

MSI link http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/...ernal-Robotics

Are you using DR or MSI? If your using DR you will be very happy using MSI instead. More options

MSI link http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/...ernal-Robotics

I am speaking of the old modular parts. I like them a lot and have made them work, I just want to know how to make the thing sturdier.

The bendiness seems to happen in Rotacts and such moving parts, but I can't seem to find an appropriate setting in .cfg file.
Hi I have been told to use magic smoke industries to download this because when I download this mod on its own It takes all my parts away AND I AM FED UP OFF REINSTALING MY GAME
Something you are doing is wrong. Are you using damned robotics or infernal?
Pitty just download the MSI and you will find so much more to work with. Also support

I think I found a bug. I was using DR parts to build a tracking antenna for a ship. The ship weights about fifty tons. On the other end was a one ton RT 900Gm dish. When I tried to unfold it from my ship, it sent the ship spinning out of control. I know both objects have inertia, but a one ton antenna has significantly less than a 50 ton ship traveling at the same velocity. The only two DR parts were a rototron and a hinge. There were no problems what so ever before I attempted to deploy the antenna.
Not sure what it is but I would try using Infernal Robotics instead. DR hasn't been updated in a while.
can you upgrade to 0.22?

can you upgrade to 0.22?

No. Damned Robotics is no longer maintained, Infernal Robotics is the successor. Use that
